sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均有"编织"之意。
means: knit ： 指用织钟把毛线等编织成衣物等。
weave ： 指用机器或手工编织物品。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)set briskly to work; begin action

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wefan, of Germanic origin, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek huphē 'web' and Sanskrit ūrnavābhi 'spider', literally 'wool-weaver'. The current noun sense dates from the late 19th cent
late 16th cent.: probably from Old Norse veifa 'to wave, brandish'

entry.def: If you weave cloth or a carpet, you make it by crossing threads over and under each other using a frame or machine called a loom.

example.ex: They would spin and weave cloth, cook and attend to the domestic side of life...
example.tran: 她们纺纱、织布、煮饭以及料理家务。

example.ex: In one room, young mothers weave while babies doze in their laps.
example.tran: 在一间屋子里，年轻的母亲们在织布，而她们的孩子就在她们膝上打盹。

entry.def: A particular weave is the way in which the threads are arranged in a cloth or carpet.

example.ex: Fabrics with a close weave are ideal for painting.
example.tran: 编织紧密的布最适合作画。

entry.def: If you weave something such as a basket, you make it by crossing long plant stems or fibres over and under each other.

example.ex: Jenny weaves baskets from willow she grows herself.
example.tran: 珍妮用她自己种的柳树的枝条编篮子。

entry.def: If you weave your way somewhere, you move between and around things as you go there.

example.ex: The cars then weaved in and out of traffic at top speed...
example.tran: 这些轿车就在车流中全速穿行。

example.ex: He weaved around the tables to where she sat with Bob...
example.tran: 他绕过一张张桌子，走到她和鲍勃坐着的地方。

entry.def: If you weave a story, you invent a complicated story.

example.ex: Jan Roberts weaves a compelling tale which traps a young woman in a world run by the Mafia.
example.tran: 简·罗伯茨编了一个引人入胜的故事，诱骗一位年轻女性进入了黑手党的地盘。

entry.tran: 将(素材等)编入（故事或设计中）
entry.def: If you weave details into a story or design, you include them, so that they are closely linked together or become an important part of the story or design.

example.ex: She weaves imaginative elements into her poems...
example.tran: 她在诗中编织着奇思妙想。

example.ex: Bragg weaves together the histories of his main characters.
example.tran: 布拉格把他主要人物的身世都串在一起。

means.word_mean: 1. pattern of weaving or structure of a fabric
1. interlace by or as it by weaving
2. create a piece of cloth by interlacing strands of fabric, such as wool or cotton;
4. to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course;

auth_sentence.content: Harvest mice weave complex spherical nests out of grass.
auth_sentence.res_content: Harvest mice weave complex spherical nests out of grass.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Harvest mice weave complex spherical nests out of grass.

Sentence.sentence: Even if I am on vacation in the mountains, I am eating food someone else has grown, living in a house someone else has built, wearing clothes someone else has sewn from cloth woven by others, using electricity someone else is distributing to my house.

Even if I am on vacation in the mountains, I am eating food someone else has grown, living in a house someone else has built, wearing clothes someone else has sewn from cloth woven by others, using electricity someone else is distributing to my house.

sentences.en: The old woman was weaving on her loom.
sentences.cn: 那位老太太正在织布机上织布。

sentences.en: He wove some branches together to form a roof.
sentences.cn: 他把一些树枝编起来搭成屋顶。

means.word_mean: 编排, 杜撰,（把…）编成，编纂成，编造（故事等）

sentences.en: He wove a fascinating tale of knights in shining armour.
sentences.cn: 他编了一个穿着明亮盔甲的骑士的迷人故事。
